data:
This order set applies to:
- Patients with diabetes managed by oral hypoglycemics (e.g. type 2 diabetes, monogenic diabetes)
- Patient who is in good metabolic control and free of ketosis prior to surgery
- Procedure is scheduled first on the surgical list, with immediate ability to resume oral intake (e.g. endoscopy, adenotonsillectomy, lumbar puncture, some dental procedures)
- Procedure will be performed under sedation or general anesthesia
Follow fasting instructions as per anesthesia
Notify endocrinology via PAC Endocrine Information Tool for insulin doses the night before procedure and the morning of procedure
Discontinue metformin at least 24 hours before elective major procedure (anticipated to be greater than 2 hours) or on the day of elective minor surgery ( anticipated to be less than 2 hours)
If less than 24 hours since the last dose of metformin for emergent major procedure, maintain adequate hydration with IV fluids pre-operatively, intra-operatively and post-operatively
If pre-existing chronic renal disease re-orders metformin 48 hours after procedure or and until stable renal function confirmed
If pre-existing normal renal function, hold metformin for 48 hours post-procedure
Constant, Clinical event: Surgery / Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: Metformin, Instructions: Hold for 48 hours post-op / post-procedure
Patients treated with Sulfonylureas, Thiazolidineodiones, DPP-IV inhibitors, GLP-1 analogs, and / or SGLT-2 inhibitors
Discontinue all medications on day of procedure
Constant, Clinical event: Surgery / Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: Sulfonylureas, Instructions: Hold on day of procedure, resume post-op once returned to full oral feeding
Constant, Clinical event: Surgery / Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: Thiazolidineodiones, Instructions: Hold on day of procedure, resume post-op once returned to full oral feeding
Constant, Clinical event: Surgery / Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: DPP-IV inhibitors, Instructions: Hold on day of procedure, resume post-op once returned to full oral feeding
Constant, Clinical event: Surgery / Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: GLP-1 analogs, Instructions: Hold on day of procedure, resume post-op once returned to full oral feeding
Constant, Clinical event: Surgery / Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: SGLT-2 inhibitors, Instructions: Hold on day of procedure, resume post-op once returned to full oral feeding
Mild to moderate hypoglycemia with POC Whole Blood less than 4 mmol/L follow step 1 and 2. For Step 1 select fast acting carbohydrate OR dextrose 10%-sodium chloride 0.9% bolus
Administer 15 g of fast acting carbohydrate, PO, once
5 mL/kg, IV, once, PRN: hypoglycemia, drug form: bag
Severe hypoglycemia if patient is unconscious and/or seizing) place orders for step 1 and 2. Select dextrose 10%-sodium chloride 0.9% bolus or glucagon in Step 1
5 mL/kg, IV, once, PRN: hypoglycemia, drug form: bag
0.03 mg/kg, IM, once, drug form: kit
0.03 mg/kg, subcutaneous, once, drug form: kit
Step 1 for patients greater than 8 kg and less than 2 years of age
0.25 mg/kg, IM, once, drug form: kit

0.5 mg/kg, IM, once, drug form: kit
